humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathology report provides a T stage of 2 for the infiltrative ductal carcinoma in the right breast. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, and the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is most likely T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. A T2 stage breast cancer has a tumor size between 2.1 to 5 cm. According to the pathology report, the T stage is reported as T2, which indicates that the tumor size is between 2.1 to 5 cm.
